column14: Frequent Flyer - Air & Loyalty Membership - Car, Hotels
column15: Offered Limo where applicable and Ensuring complete address & phone number
column18: PNR Documentation in P5H & Reference (Receive Field)
column19: Captured correct Apptivo case number & used Apptivo for communication
column20: Options & class of service as per client policy
column21: No Show / Cancellations / Changes to be advised correctly
column22: Capture accurate reason codes (Missed/Realized) & Low Fare in the script
column24: Process accurate re-issuance (Tax code, add collect, WFRF, WFR)
column26: Client Specifics (if any) & Standard Operating Procedure related
column30: Correct Service fee selection (Air, Car, Hotel, Other)
column32: Used CWT Itinerary / Clipboard / Sabre format as per client
column33: Utilized cross sell & up sell opportunity (Hotel, Car, Insurance)
column34: Quotation based on request (Date, Time, City Pair)

column43: Offered Limo where applicable and Ensuring complete address & phone number: The agent should have waited for the client to provide their address and also requested a contact phone number before issuing the ticket. If the client did not respond with these details in a timely manner, the agent should have followed up to request the information again prior to ticketing.; Utilized cross sell & up sell opportunity (Hotel, Car, Insurance): The agent should look for natural openings to politely inquire about the client's hotel, ground transport or insurance needs when booking international travel. A soft, open-ended question could uncover additional service opportunities without being pushy. When an add-on like a limo booking is offered, it must be properly executed.
